required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Investigation of Changes in Lower Limb Muscles After Cerebrovascular Accident
clinical_study.official_title: Reliability Study of a 3D Free-hand Ultrasonography Technique (3DfUS) in Combination With Instrumented Spasticity Assessment (ISA) for the Lower Limb in Chronic First-ever Stroke Patients.

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to investigate lower limb muscles after cerebrovascular accident

detailed_description.textblock: The aim of this study is to define and differentiate the changes in MMT properties related to the alterations in muscle tone of the lower limb in first-ever chronic stroke patients by using a 3D free-hand Ultrasonography (3DfUS) technique in combination with an instrumented spasticity assessment (IPSA). In these chronic stroke patients, the spontaneous neurological recovery is stabilized

primary_outcome.description: Estimation of muscle volume by 3D freehand ultrasonography.
Estimation of muscle volume by 3D freehand ultrasonography
Estimation of echogenicity intensity by 3D freehand ultrasonography on an 8-bit greyscale (256 values).

primary_outcome.measure: Work [J] derived from the slow stretch
primary_outcome.description: Measurement of Work [J] by Instrumented Spasticity Assessment

primary_outcome.measure: Muscle activity EMG [uV] derived from the fast stretch
primary_outcome.description: Measurement of Muscle activity EMG [uV] by Instrumented Spasticity Assessment
Measurement of Maximal velocity of performance (Vmax [deg/s]) by Instrumented Spasticity Assessment

primary_outcome.measure: Range of motion [deg] for slow stretch
primary_outcome.description: Measurement of Range of motion [deg] by Instrumented Spasticity Assessment
Measurement of Stiffness [Nm/deg] by Instrumented Spasticity Assessment

primary_outcome.measure: Joint angle of catch [deg] from the fast stretch
primary_outcome.description: Measurement of Joint angle of catch [deg] from the fast stretch by Instrumented Spasticity Assessment

primary_outcome.measure: Angle of EMG threshold [deg] from the fast stretch
primary_outcome.description: Measurement of Angle of EMG threshold [deg] by Instrumented Spasticity Assessment

primary_outcome.measure: Intensity of catch derived from the fast stretch
primary_outcome.description: Measurement of Intensity of catch by Instrumented Spasticity Assessment

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical assessment of spasticity at fast stretch
secondary_outcome.description: Estimation of spasticity by Modified Assessment Scale

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical assessment of spasticity angle at slow and fast stretch
secondary_outcome.description: Estimation of spasticity by Tardieu Scale

other_outcome.measure: Quantify the impairment caused by a stroke
other_outcome.description: Evaluation of impairment caused by stroke by National Institute Health Stroke Scale

other_outcome.measure: Assessments of functional independence in daily life in stroke patients and healthy subjects
other_outcome.description: Evaluation of functional independence in daily life is assessed by the Barthel Index

other_outcome.measure: Assessments of functional status after stroke
other_outcome.description: Evaluation of functional status after stroke is assessed by the Functional Independence Measure

other_outcome.measure: Assessesment of mobility in stroke patients
other_outcome.description: Evaluation of mobility after stroke is assessed by the Rivermead Mobility Index

other_outcome.measure: Assessment of transfer skills in stroke patients and healthy subjects
other_outcome.description: Measurement of functional lower extremity strength and/or identify movement strategies in stroke patients and healthy subjects by The Five Times Sit to Stand Test

other_outcome.measure: Assessment of the motor impairment in lower limbs of stroke patients
other_outcome.description: Measurement of lower limb strength in stroke patients by the Motricity Index

other_outcome.measure: Assessments of gait speed analysis in stroke patients and healthy subjects.
other_outcome.time_frame: Measurement of gait speed in stroke patients and healthy subjects by 5-Meter Walk Test at comfortable or self-selected gait speed.

arm_group.description: Adults with first-ever chronic CVA and leg spasticity

intervention.description: 3DfUS technique enhances a conventional 2D US device into a platform capable of reconstructing 3D anatomical data sets. IPSA for quantification of hyper-resistance and its underlying components. The sensors in the IPSa include gyroscopes and accelerometers to measure joint angle and angular velocity, EMG to measure muscle activity, and a 3 degrees-of freedom force sensor to measure torque applied on the joint. clinical functional capacity = clinical evaluation of degree of independence, mobility and gait

study_pop.textblock:
Adults with first ever chronic stroke:
= First ever stroke subjects with established spasticity and without spasticity will be recruited on the stroke rehabilitation unit and outpatient rehabilitation clinic, University Hospital of Leuven.
Healthy control subjects
= Healthy age-and gender matched subjects will be recruited among healthy university staff of the University Hospital of Leuven, their family and friends.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Definition of case population :
o first ever stroke with spasticity of the lower limb.
- Definition of control :
- first ever stroke without spasticity of the lower limb
- healthy aged-matched subjects
Exclusion Criteria:
- Musculoskeletal or neurological problems affecting the lower limb
- Presence of other neurological pathology that could lead to spasticity, ataxia, dystonia
- Cognitive problems that impede measurements
- Severe co-morbidities
- Peripheral spastic medication
